turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Arthurite.
turn.2: Arthurite  Arthurite is a mineral composed of divalent copper and iron ions in combination with trivalent arsenate, phosphate and sulfate ions with hydrogen and oxygen.
turn.4: Initially discovered by Sir Arthur Russell in 1954 at Hingston Down Consols mine in Calstock, Cornwall, England, arthurite is formed as a resultant mineral in the oxidation region of some copper deposits by the variation of enargite or arsenopyrite.
turn.6: The chemical formula of Arthurite is CuFe(AsO,PO,SO)(O,OH)•4HO.
turn.7: Where did the name come from?
turn.8: Arthurite is named after Arthur W. G. Kingsbury (1906–1968), a British mineralogist, and Sir Arthur Russell (1878–1964), a collector of minerals.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: Arthurite was determined to be a uniquely new mineral by R.J. Davis and M.H. Hey in 1964 after its initial discovery.
turn.12: A second specimen was confirmed by A.H Clark and R.H. Sillitoe (1969) from Potrerillos, Atacama Province, Chile in 1969.
